comment: Goes slow enough to give you a solid grasp on the topic. Works out examples, but often he messes up on his own work. Homework is easy and gives multiple attempts. Textbook and homework is online, so theoretically you can stay home and review the PowerPoints and textbook online, but I recommend you show up to get the examples worked out.

rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Kris Ford is the best. He helped me discover my love for calculus. He does a ton of examples, gives practice tests and encourages questions. He's also pretty funny. My mom was really sick this semester and he was so helpful in making sure I stayed caught up. I am already looking forward to taking cal 2 even though it won't be with him.
Really the best math prof at KSU, i'm sad that he doesn't teach that many classes. take him if you can!

He goes really slow in class and encourages everyone to ask questions if they are confused. He will do as many examples as you ask him to and actually cares if his students are confused and wants to help.
Good Prof!! Easy class, skipped a few days but the power points are on mymathlab so you can literally study at home and show up for review days and test and quiz days and make an A.
Took him in Spring 2017 and found him to be quite a good professor.  Very thorough, although I must admit that you do need to study.  Calc II isn't a joke.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Nice guy. teaches well. took him for Calc 1 and 2
Very nice, very solid professor. Does not go into major detail but just enough to understand the material. Sometimes will make mistakes but they are pretty minor. Tests come from homework questions.

Gives bonus points out on every test and quiz, plus he drops the lowest quiz grade at the end of the semester.  I have a lot of friends who say their calc profs expect you to know calc coming in, but this guy's not like that. Only problem I have is that he messes up on his own problems demonstrating to the class; otherwise pretty solid.
Absolutely awesome professor. Very kind, caring, and really wants you to succeed. Tells you exactly what to study, answers all questions, and will explain anything as many times as you need.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Doesn't really do partial credit, but he let's you know exactly what you need to study for. He is a really nice guy though, and will answer all your questions without making you feel dumb. Just pay attention and do the homework.

Really cares if you do well in his class. He doesn't mind answering any questions and will meet with you whenever you need to for additional help. Not a overwhelming amount of homework. Tells you what to study for quizzes and tests.
He tends to mess up a lot of his own math problems in class and does not give out any study guides.
